contentrichtext.text: '''Zheng Wenguang''' ({{zh|c=郑文光|p=Zhèng Wén Guāng}}, 9 April 1929 - 17 June 2003) was a Chinese science fiction writer. Zheng was born in [[Vietnam]], but moved to [[China]] in 1947. He was first published in 1954 and continued to write until a stroke in 1983. That stated he had to quit writing science fiction during the [[Cultural Revolution]] due to official pressure.<ref>[http://english.people.com.cn/200306/17/eng20030617_118407.shtml People's Daily]</ref> He also was a research fellow at the Beijing Astronomical Observatory.
